title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Safety of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Safety of 

Toys) (Amendment) (No. 4) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 5 December 2022.

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: 2. Schedule 1 to the European Union (Safety of Toys) Regulations 2011
text_raw:
2. Schedule 1 to the European Union (Safety of Toys) Regulations 2011 

(S.I. No. 14 of 2011) is amended – 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph 17: 

“17. Commission Directive 2020/2089/EU of 11 December 

20203,”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 17: 
“18. Commission Directive 2021/903/EU of 3 June 20212 .”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 December, 2022. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

1 OJ L 170, 30.6.2009, p. 1–37. 
2 OJ L 197, 4.6.2021, p. 110–113. 
3 OJ L 423, 15.12.2020, p. 58–61. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [622] 3

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations give effect to Commission Directive 2021/903/EU of 3 June 
2021 which amends Appendix C to Annex II to Directive 2009/48/EC of the 
European Parliament and of the Council on the safety of toys, as regards 
aniline. This Directive sets a limit for aniline in textile toy material and leather 
toy material of 30 mg/kg after reductive cleavage and a limit for aniline in 
finger paints of 10 mg/kg as free aniline and 30 mg/kg after reductive cleavage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [622]
